topic: How to combine wave with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to combine wave with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)

response_parsed.title: Combining Wave and Typing for Production Code in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer demonstrates the usage of Wave and Type Hints together in Python 3.12+ for writing more type-safe, maintainable, and efficient production code.
key_points: Understanding the benefits of using Type Hints for readability and maintainability.
Leveraging Wave to enforce static type checking at runtime without sacrificing runtime performance.
Using mypy for type checking during development.
Improving autocompletion in IDEs by adding Type Hints.
version_notes: Required packages: typing, math (for sin function)
For static type checking during development: mypy
caveats: Wave does not provide runtime type errors by default.
Ensure to run your code through a linter for consistent formatting and style.
